thread.title: Bulldogs playing host to five-star target
thread.title_full: Bulldogs playing host to five-star target

title: Bulldogs playing host to five-star target
text:
Bulldogs playing host to five-star target A five-star prospect and top UGA target is in Athens for the second time in three weeks. Slot to Georgia Links 
ATHENS, Ga. -- Georgia is hosting one of its top overall targets for the 2018 class for the second time in three weeks. Scotland County (Laurenberg, N.C.) running back Zamir White was spotted by Dawgs247 at the UGA men’s basketball game against Kentucky on Saturday. 
White took an unofficial visit to Georgia back on January 28 as well. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) 
Clemson, Georgia, and North Carolina are at the top for the five-star ball carrier with the Tigers out front. Clemson has a commanding lead per the 247Sports Crystal Ball with 87 percent of the submissions. Georgia and North Carolina have seven percent each. 
Ranked as the No. 3 overall prospect in the nation by the 247Sports Composite, White rushed for 5,083 yards and 85 touchdowns in his three-year high school career. He’s seen as the nation’s top running back and as the top player in North Carolina for the 2018 cycle.
